title: Continually Updating Generative Retrieval on Dynamic Corpora. (arXiv:2305.18952v2 [cs.IR] UPDATED)
abstract: The majority of prior work on information retrieval (IR) assumes that the corpus is static, whereas in the real world, the documents are continually updated. In this paper, we incorporate often overlooked dynamic nature of knowledge into the retrieval systems. Our work treats retrieval not as static archives but as dynamic knowledge bases better aligned with real-world environments. We conduct a comprehensive evaluation of dual encoders and generative retrieval, utilizing the StreamingQA benchmark designed for the temporal knowledge updates. Our initial results show that while generative retrieval outperforms dual encoders in static settings, the opposite is true in dynamic settings. Surprisingly, however, when we utilize a parameter-efficient pre-training method to enhance adaptability of generative retrieval to new corpora, our resulting model, Dynamic Generative Retrieval (DynamicGR), exhibits unexpected findings. tldr: 本文研究了动态语料库上的生成检索。实验结果表明，在静态设置下，生成检索效果优于双编码器，但在动态设置下情况相反。通过使用参数高效的预训练方法，我们的模型DynamicGR在新的语料库上展现出了意外的性能。
en_tdlr: This paper investigates generative retrieval on dynamic corpora. The results show that while generative retrieval outperforms dual encoders in static settings, the opposite is true in dynamic settings. By using a parameter-efficient pre-training method, the DynamicGR model exhibits unexpected performance on new corpora.
